question: 響く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>echo</kanji> so the verb is <vocabulary>to echo</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: <reading>He be</reading> (<ja>ひび</ja>) echoing... <reading>He be</reading> (<ja>ひび</ja>) echoing... <reading>He be</reading> (<ja>ひび</ja>) echoing... <reading>He be</reading> (<ja>ひび</ja>) echoing... <reading>He be</reading> (<ja>ひび</ja>) echoing...
